Kenneth Stanley wrote:

>I'd also be interested in hearing what people are up to these days. 
>By the way, Colin, what kinds of projects are people proposing with 
>SharpNEAT?
>  
>
I don't want to say too much right away because these guys might want to 
make a post themselves or may wish to stay out of the limelight. What I 
can say is that one is taking a fresh look at Go and the other is 
evolving a net for part of the auto-pilot of a model airplane. From what 
I've seen this latter experiment is up and running using flight sim 
software as the basis for an evaluation function.

>As for myself, I'm still working on the NERO video game and the 
>collision warning project with Toyota.  I'm also continuing to think a 
>lot about indirect encoding and what a next-generation indirect 
>version of NEAT might look like.
>  
>
Thanks. Looking forward to seeing some papers on those, and a NERO 
download I believe?

Colin.
